By  Cameron OrrOctober  

Illinois hunters will have the additional option of using certain types of handguns during this years regular hunting season in addition to the shotguns and muzzleloading rifles previously allowed PERIOD

In other years the use of handguns was restricted to a special handgunonly season from Jan PERIOD  to  to help reduce the population of surplus deer said Carol Knowles spokeswoman for the Illinois Department of Natural Resources which regulates hunting in the state PERIOD

Illinois government recently passed legislation allowing the additional opportunity to be presented to hunters PERIOD

Many hunters have asked for a change weve tried to provide that for them Knowles said PERIOD

The new regulations will allow any hunter with a permit for the firearm deer season to use centerfire revolvers or centerfire singleshot handguns of . caliber or larger with a minimum barrel length of four inches PERIOD Hunters can take a shotgun muzzleloading rifle andor a handgun with them during this season held Nov PERIOD  to  and Dec PERIOD  to  PERIOD

Knowles said the new regulations differ from those used in the special January season and will allow for a wider variation in the types of handguns allowed PERIOD In addition the department of natural resources will continue its handgunonly season PERIOD

Also in place is a muzzleloaderonly season from Dec PERIOD  to  for which thousands of permits are readily available PERIOD There also will be an archery season that began Oct PERIOD  and ends Jan PERIOD  with breaks during firearm season PERIOD
